text: Anthony Bourdain hates truffle oil but
he's not the only chef there's a growing
movement against this stuff truffle oil
gets its name from truffles a fungus
that's renowned for being the world's
most expensive food during the 80s and
90s truffle oil flourish chefs drizzled
it over dishes to add a truffle leaf
flavor and aroma it gave the allure of
eating truffles but without the
exorbitant cost there's just one problem
most truffle oils contain no actual
truffle and for that some famous chefs
have publicly denounced it
so if truffle oil isn't made from
truffles then what is it
usually it's olive oil or sunflower oil
with a touch of - for dye via pentane -
for dye Thea pentane is a pungent
compound that gives truffle oil its
scent it's usually labeled under natural
flavors on ingredients lists it is one
compound among hundreds that gives
truffles their flavour which means
truffle oil lacks the complexity of real
truffles but don't let that stop you
from using it you want a fair assessment
truffle grower Guerra through now then
suggests this
you
